item.title: PI questions PLEASE HELP
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Well some sources have a commands.java that looks like, cant remember exact, but like this:

Basically, you wouldnt need to declare the player rights if you put it under there, because its under player level commands which means basically anything under there is for players +

so if your commands.java is like that, just search that, but for mods, and yeah…

item.title: PI questions PLEASE HELP
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

if(c.playerRights >= 0) {
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“pure”) && c.pure == 0) {
int i = 0;
c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 0);
c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 2);
c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 3);
c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 4);
c.getPA().addSkillXP((15000000), 6);
c.playerXP[3] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]);
c.getPA().refreshSkill(3);
c.pure = 1;

item.title: PI questions PLEASE HELP
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Zachs Owner Zachs
item.description:
@Owner_Zachs wrote:

I have a few codes I want to max but I keep getting errors…

I want to make it so I can type ::richbitch and they will get max cash

And I want to make this command so its for mod+

if (playerCommand.startsWith("spec")) { c.specAmount = 500.0;

How do I make this so It works for all players

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("pure")) { if (c.inWild()) return; c.playerXP[0] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(60)+5; c.playerLevel[0] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[0]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(0); c.playerXP[2] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(70)+5; c.playerLevel[2] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[2]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(2); c.playerXP[3] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(70)+5; c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(3); c.playerXP[4] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(70)+5; c.playerLevel[4] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[4]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(4); c.playerXP[6] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(55)+5; c.playerLevel[6] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[6]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(6);

Read full topic
